SEARCH
Package hms.storage

Class TextService

java.lang.Object
hms.storage.TextService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IReadable, IWritable
public class TextService extends Object implements IReadable, IWritable
Handles all operations related to reading from and writing to the appointment text file. This includes CRUD operations for appointments based on unique identifiers such as doctor ID, patient ID, date, and time.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public List<List<String>> read(String filePath)
      Reads data from a specified file path and returns it as a list of list of strings. Each sublist represents a line in the file, and each string within the sublist represents a field in that line.
      Specified by:
      read in interface IReadable
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file to be read.
      Returns:
      A list of lists, where each inner list represents a row of the file.

    • write

      public void write(String filePath, List<List<String>> data)
      Writes data from a list of list of strings to a specified file path. Each sublist is written as a line in the file, with each string in the sublist separated by a comma.
      Specified by:
      write in interface IWritable
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file where the data should be written.
      data - The list of lists representing the data to write, where each inner list represents a row to be written to the file.

    • writeAppointmentsToTxt

      public static void writeAppointmentsToTxt(List<Appointment> appointments)
      Writes a list of appointments to a text file.
      Parameters:
      appointments - The list of Appointment objects to write to the file.

    • readAppointmentsFromTxt

      public static List<Appointment> readAppointmentsFromTxt()
      Reads appointments from a text file and returns them as a list of Appointment objects.
      Returns:
      A list of Appointment objects read from the file.

    • getPatientAppointment

      public static List<Appointment> getPatientAppointment(String patientID)
      Retrieves all appointments associated with a specific patient ID.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The patient ID to filter appointments by.
      Returns:
      A list of Appointment objects matching the given patient ID.

    • getDoctorAppointment

      public static List<Appointment> getDoctorAppointment(String doctorID)
      Retrieves all appointments associated with a specific doctor ID.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The doctor ID to filter appointments by.
      Returns:
      A list of Appointment objects matching the given doctor ID.

    • replaceAppointment

      public static void replaceAppointment(Appointment apt_new)
      Replaces an existing appointment in the text file with new data.
      Parameters:
      apt_new - The updated Appointment object to replace the old one.

    • findAppointment

      public static int findAppointment(Appointment apt_new)
      Finds the index of a specific appointment in the text file based on multiple attributes.
      Parameters:
      apt_new - The Appointment object to find in the text file.
      Returns:
      The index of the appointment in the list, or -1 if not found.

    • writeAppointment

      public static void writeAppointment(Appointment apt_new, int index)
      Writes a specific Appointment object to the text file at a specified index.
      Parameters:
      apt_new - The new Appointment object to write to the file.
      index - The index at which to write the appointment.

    • appendAppointment

      public static void appendAppointment(Appointment apt)
      Appends a new Appointment object to the end of the text file.
      Parameters:
      apt - The new Appointment object to add to the file.

    • clearTxt

      public static void clearTxt()
      Clears all appointment data from the text file while keeping the header line intact.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method for testing purposes, simulating file writing and reading operations.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments.
